title: Ticket #5809: peaceful shutdown command not behaving as messages indicate
description:
There is no evidence that this command actually sends any messages to the startd despite what it prints out. I've tried variations on this command including the FQDN and slot1@FQDN. 

root@condorcm:~# condor_off -peaceful execute1034
Sent "Set-Peaceful-Shutdown" command to startd execute1034.nemo.phys.uwm.edu
Can't find address for schedd execute1034.nemo.phys.uwm.edu
Can't find address for execute1034.nemo.phys.uwm.edu

So I RTFM'd and see that you recommend including -startd in the argument list. I tried that. It outwardly looks better 

root@condorcm:~# condor_off -peaceful -startd execute1034.nemo.phys.uwm.edu
Sent "Set-Peaceful-Shutdown" command to startd execute1034.nemo.phys.uwm.edu
Sent "Kill-Daemon-Peacefully" command to master execute1034.nemo.phys.uwm.edu

And the jobs go into the retiring state, which seems reasonable enough. But the StartLog actually prints that it's doing a graceful shutdown. 

07/27/16 10:27:34 Got SIGTERM. Performing graceful shutdown.
07/27/16 10:27:34 shutdown graceful

So I think the right command is doing the right thing but logging inaccurately. I think a command that should be right-enough is print half the right-message but doing nothing.
remarks:
2016-Jul-27 11:24:37 by wenger:
Hmm -- seems like there are several problems here:
  • Without -startd, the right thing is not even happening.
  • The message is confusing/incorrect.

(BTW, condor_off -help says that -startd, etc., are deprecated. So apparently, "-daemon startd" is preferred.)
